title: Game Theory – Payoff Matrix
description: Test your understanding of payoff matrices, reading outcomes, and best responses.

questions.question: In a 2×2 payoff matrix, each cell shows:
options: Payoffs to both players under that strategy profile
questions.explanation: A profile (s_A, s_B) maps to an ordered pair (u_A, u_B).

questions.question: If Player B chooses Column 1, Player A comparing Row 1 payoff 4 vs Row 2 payoff 2 should choose:
questions.explanation: Best response is the higher payoff: 4 > 2 → Row 1.

questions.question: A symmetric game has:
questions.explanation: Role reversal leaves payoffs unchanged in symmetric games.

questions.question: Which is TRUE for zero-sum games?
questions.explanation: Zero-sum means one’s gain is the other’s loss.

questions.question: Reading (3, 5) in a cell means:
questions.explanation: By convention, first is Player A’s payoff, second is Player B’s.
